bibl.title: Letter from Kenneth F. Maxcy to Frederick F. Russell, December 18, 1923

div1.p: Maxcy asks Russell if he could have a copy of Carter's manuscript, "The Epidemiology of Yellow Fever."

div1.head: Letter from Kenneth F. Maxcy to Frederick F. Russell, December 18, 1923
div1.opener:
COPY
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
United States
Public Health Service
Montgomery, Ala.
December 18, 1923.
Dear Dr. Russell:
div1.p:
Recently I had the pleasure of a little visit with Dr. H.
R. Carter in the hospital at Baltimore. Among other things he
mentioned the fact that he had completed his manuscript on
“The Epidemiology of Yellow Fever,” and that you were having it
mimeographed. I am taking the liberty of writing you to ask
whether there is an extra copy available which you could send to
me; I should very much appreciate the privilege of having one.

With best personal regards and wishing you the compliments
of the season.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, (Signed) Kenneth F. Maxcy
Asst. Surg. U.S.P.H.S. Dr. F. F. Russell
International Health Board
61 Broadway
New York City
